main event: A civilian in Fayetteville, North Carolina reported seeing a pale yellow light in the sky that drifted slowly overhead in 1966.
interesting points: Children described the object as looking like a shooting star that did not go out.
The object had a slow, southwest drift, which the investigator attributed to the wind direction at the time.
The investigator believed the sighting was likely due to a special forces search exercise utilizing high intensity parachute flares.
There were no photographs or physical evidence associated with the sighting.
The observer was a civilian copywriter for a local radio station, with a 'fair' reliability rating.
result: probable parachute flares from a special forces exercise
sighted object: a pale yellow light in the sky
